SEARCH
Package com.weather.sdk

Class DefaultWeatherSDK

java.lang.Object
com.weather.sdk.DefaultWeatherSDK
All Implemented Interfaces:
WeatherSDK, Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class DefaultWeatherSDK extends Object implements WeatherSDK
Default implementation of WeatherSDK interface for Phase 1.

This implementation provides full production-ready functionality including:

  • Intelligent caching with LRU eviction and TTL support
  • HTTP client integration with OpenWeatherAPI
  • Comprehensive metrics collection and tracking
  • Thread-safe operations for concurrent access
  • Proper resource management and lifecycle handling

Thread Safety: This implementation is thread-safe and supports concurrent access from multiple threads without external synchronization. All operations use thread-safe collections and atomic variables for metrics tracking.

Since:
1.0.0

      Returns:

    • getWeather

      public WeatherData getWeather(String cityName) throws WeatherSDKException, InterruptedException
      Retrieves current weather data for the specified city with intelligent caching.

      This method implements the following logic:

      1. Validates the SDK is not shut down
      2. Normalizes the city name (trimmed, lowercase)
      3. Checks cache first for fresh data (within TTL)
      4. If cache hit: records metrics and returns cached data
      5. If cache miss: fetches from OpenWeatherAPI
      6. Caches successful API responses
      7. Records all metrics for performance tracking
      Specified by:
      getWeather in interface WeatherSDK
      Parameters:
      cityName - the name of the city to retrieve weather for (must not be null or empty)
      Returns:
      the current weather data for the specified city
      Throws:
      WeatherSDKException - for weather-related errors (API key, network, etc.)
      InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted during retry attempts
      IllegalArgumentException - if cityName is null or empty after trimming
      IllegalStateException - if this SDK instance has been shut down

    • getMetrics

      public SDKMetrics getMetrics()
      Returns current SDK performance and usage metrics.

      This method provides insights into SDK performance including:

      • Total API requests made
      • Cache hit/miss statistics
      • API success/failure rates
      • Average response times
      • Last API call timestamp

      Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple threads. The returned metrics object is a snapshot of current values.

      Specified by:
      getMetrics in interface WeatherSDK
      Returns:
      current SDK metrics and performance statistics
      See Also:
      • SDKMetrics

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes this SDK instance and releases all resources.

      This method delegates to shutdown() to ensure consistent resource cleanup.

      Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently from multiple threads.

      Idempotent: This method can be called multiple times safely.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Specified by:
      close in interface WeatherSDK

    • isShutdown

      Returns:

    • validateNotShutdown

      protected void validateNotShutdown()

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this instance is shut down

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Gracefully shuts down the SDK instance and releases all associated resources.

      This method performs proper cleanup:

      • Stops any background polling threads
      • Closes HTTP client connections
      • Clears internal resources
      • Marks the instance as shut down

      Thread Safety: This method can be called safely from any thread. After shutdown, subsequent method calls will throw IllegalStateException.

      Idempotent: This method can be called multiple times safely.

      Specified by:
      shutdown in interface WeatherSDK
